intro: Orthosiphon australis, commonly known as the Australian horsegram or small-leaf horsegram, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture and its spikes of small, pale blue to purple flowers. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Orthosiphon australis is also known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional Australian herbal remedies.
